meanings.definition: Those who are undecided or hesitant in making a decision.
meanings.sent1: The waverers in the group couldn't choose between pizza or burgers for lunch.
meanings.sent2: The waverers in the class couldn't decide on a movie to watch.
meanings.sent3: The waverers at the ice cream shop spent ages trying to pick a flavor.
meanings.sent4: The waverers in the debate club kept switching sides during the argument.
meanings.sent5: The waverers in the election booth struggled to pick a candidate.

meanings.definition: People who fluctuate in their opinions or beliefs.
meanings.sent1: The waverers in the office changed their minds about the project multiple times.
meanings.sent2: The waverers in the family couldn't agree on a vacation destination.
meanings.sent3: The waverers in the book club kept changing their favorite genres.
meanings.sent4: The waverers in the sports team couldn't settle on a team strategy.
meanings.sent5: The waverers in the jury room kept switching their verdicts.
